title: Bug 113047 - No children node listing when changing data source for a data set in data set editor page of the query tab
OB: When changing the data source for a data set in the data set editor page of the query tab, the children nodes are not listed. Actual result: No children node listing is shown when changing the data source for a data set in the data set editor page of the query tab. To reproduce the issue: 1. Create a new data set without an SQL statement. 2. The new data source should have no database, table, or column information. Close the data set editor and reopen it.
SR: 1. Create a new data set without providing an SQL statement. 2. Choose a data source that has no database, table, or column information. 3. Open the data set editor in the query tab. 4. Change the data source for the data set. 5. Observe that the children nodes are not listed. 6. Close the data set editor and reopen it to see if the issue persists.
